alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Fairfield; Franklin; Licking; Pickaway (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 7:15AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF FRANKLIN, FAIRFIELD, NORTHEASTERN PICKAWAY, SOUTHEASTERN DELAWARE AND LICKING COUNTIES THROUGH 800 AM EDT... At 715 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Gahanna, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Newark, Lancaster, Westerville, Reynoldsburg, Grove City, Upper Arlington, Gahanna, Pickerington, Circleville, Bexley, Heath, Granville, Pataskala, Canal Winchester, Groveport, Johnstown, Ashville, Baltimore and Buckeye Lake. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 92 and 142, and near mile marker 144. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 88 and 117. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
